label: 乳母
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
説明文: Wetnurse, or father of the wetnurse. The father of the wetnurse　became the person responsible for raising and providing for his ward. In thirteenth and　fourteenth century Japan, administrative, rather than high-ranking nobles, were most　commonly appointed to this post.
